clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of a Plant Protein Diet to a Animal Protein Diet Emphasized in Type 2 Diabetics
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of a High-protein, Carbohydrate-restricted Diet With a High Proportion of Leguminous Protein Compared to Animal Protein on Metabolic Control in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes, "LeguAN Study"

collaborator.agency: Ministry of Food and Agriculture, Germany
Klinikum Ernst von Bergmann Augenklinik Laserzentrum
Institute of Gain Processing IGV GmbH, Potsdam

brief_summary.textblock: This 6-week parallel randomised prospective dietary intervention study with type 2 Diabetes investigates the nutrition influence of animal protein in comparison to plant protein on the glucose metabolism.

detailed_description.textblock: 2x20 patients with Diabetes mellitus type 2 are randomise by a blind computer assist for an equal allocation in both groups (animal protein vs. plant protein). The food components for both groups are 40% carbohydrates, 30% fat and 30% protein. The carbohydrates are correspond with a high fiber content and a low blood sugar effectiveness of carbohydrates (glycemic index).

primary_outcome.measure: Variance of glucose metabolism after different diet intervention
primary_outcome.description: Change of insulin sensitivity measured by hyperinsulinaemic euglycaemic clamp and meal time test (MTT)

secondary_outcome.measure: Development of indices for the prediction of liver fat mass
secondary_outcome.description: Change of fat fraction in liver, abdominal and in the total body fat measuring by MRI/H1-spectroscopy

secondary_outcome.measure: Development of indices for the prediction of body fat mass
secondary_outcome.description: Change of body fat measuring by body composition assessment (BODPOD) and bioelectrical impedance analysis (BIA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Expression Change of inflammatory markers in blood and fat tissue
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of gene expression of inflammation cytokines
Molecular mechanisms between nutrition, intestinal bacteria and host
Change of blood pressure, weight, body mass index, waist-hip ratio
Changes in the levels of composite circulating inflammatory and metabolic syndrome biomarkers
Change of intestinal hormones measured with a meal time test (MTT)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diabetes mellitus, type 2
- HbA1c between 6-11%
Exclusion Criteria:
- Consumptive or high grade diseases
- Intake of metabolic influence a/o anticoagulent drugs (e.g. cortisone, ASS, antibiotics)
- Diabetes type 1
- Pregnancy
- Chronic disease of heart, kidney, liver
- High grade anaemia
- High grade infection disease
- Relevant change of body weight (+/- 5 kg) since 8 weeks before begin of study Intervention
- Missing data about primary outcome measures (hyperinsulinaemic euglycaemic clamp, mealtime test, data about dietary intake from food diaries or food protocols)
- Significant deviation from dietary targets during the monitored 6 weeks isoenergetic period
- Allergies including food allergies
